Articles.Content: I watch this whenever I can when we're in Michigan, we get it on our TV. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

There's a reason we call struts "duct tape."

Keep your stick on the ice.
Love Red Green. "If the women don't find you handsome, at least they'll find you handy."
Wow, he's still around? I watched this guy on Public Access Television in High School.
The handyman's secret weapon: Duct Tape!

The Handyman's Prayer (From How to Fix Everything)

Our Father,

Who art a craftsman,

Perfectionist be thy name,

Thy power tools hum,

Thy walls are plum,

Upstairs as they are in the basement,

Give us this day a utility shed,

And forgive us our borrowed tools,

As we forgive those who borrow tools from us,

And lead us not into renovation,

But deliver us from moving,

For thine is the hammer,

And the Skill Saw,

And the Duct Tape forever.

I loved this show as a kid, and I was able to see Red perform during the how to fix everything tour. Still like to go back and watch some episodes every now and then when I have the chance.

I found that the best things were Handyman corner and Handyman tip, Many of his "be cheap n lazy" type inventions look like they would work as advertised ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I found that the best things were Handyman corner and Handyman tip, Many of his "be cheap n lazy" type inventions look like they would work as advertised ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'd say that handyman corner is the most kerbal part of the show considering that its all made out of trash used parts and stolen property but it works! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Montrose is the explosives expert:

I have been a fan of this show since I was six or seven years old, I swear one of my all time dreams was to build a life size replica of Possum Lodge in the backwoods of Ontario both exterior and Interior and live in it, that or rent it out like a Bed and Breakfast, like in that one episode where Possum Lodge was temporarily turned into a Bed and Breakfast.
